At the time, President Bush rejected two resignation letters, five days apart, from Donald Rumsfeld . Another 21/2 years passed before President Bush , facing the Republicans' loss of Congress, decided to let Donald Rumsfeld go. Looking back, I see there are things the administration could have done differently and better with respect to wartime detention, Donald Rumsfeld acknowledges. Donald Rumsfeld argues that the administration was wrong to have been so focused on preserving presidential powers that it initially eschewed negotiations with Congress in formulating detainee policy.
